poem:
### Windows of Manhattan

Father's breath thinner  
in the city's veins—  
three sisters' hearts tethered,  
by love and ache.  
  
In his shadowed room,  
ghosts of their quarrels,  
gather like dust motes,  
in morning light.  

The apartment holds  
their whispered tears,  
stories untold,  
and the quiet of parting.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "His Three Daughters review – exquisitely judged New York sibling drama Their father, Vincent, is dying. And this, perhaps, is the only thing that estranged sisters Rachel (Natasha Lyonne), Christina (Elizabeth Olsen) and Katie (Carrie Coon) can agree upon. Flung together in the Manhattan apartment where Vincent (Jay O Sanders) lived, with Rachel on hand as his carer and companion, the women’s long-submerged tensions bubble to the surface. Written and directed by Azazel Jacobs –". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
